cluster_classes.class_description: Corrosion mechanisms occurring at elevated temperatures, including oxidation and sulfidation, affecting material integrity.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: Corrosion at high temperatures, affecting material integrity.

cluster_classes.class_description: The Heat Affected Zone (HAZ) is the region of base metal adjacent to a weld that has not melted but has experienced changes in microstructure and mechanical properties due to the heat of welding.

members.entity_description: The portion of the base metal adjacent to a weld with altered microstructure and properties due to welding heat.

cluster_classes.class_description: Corrosion mechanisms at high temperature not limited to oxidation or sulfidation.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: Corrosion at high temperatures, affecting material integrity.

members.entity_description: Corrosion occurring at elevated temperatures, affecting material integrity.

args.new_description: Corrosion mechanisms occurring at elevated temperatures, including but not limited to oxidation and sulfidation, affecting material integrity.
args.justification: Both classes describe high-temperature corrosion mechanisms with overlapping descriptions and evidence, and are currently in the same class_group; merging eliminates redundancy and clarifies the schema.
Entity 'High Temperature Corrosion' fits the merged class definition and should be consolidated under the unified class.
Confirm and retain the correct Class_Group for the merged class.
Class 'Heat Affected Zone (HAZ)' is distinct from corrosion mechanisms and correctly grouped under 'Welded Joint Zones'. Confirming Class_Group.

executed_decisions.justification: Both classes describe high-temperature corrosion mechanisms with overlapping descriptions and evidence, and are currently in the same class_group; merging eliminates redundancy and clarifies the schema.
